intro: Gladiolus nanus, commonly known as the dwarf gladiolus, is a compact, herbaceous perennial plant native to South Africa. It features upright, sword-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white, pink, and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters, making it ideal for rock gardens or as a border plant. It blooms in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate touch to garden spaces. Due to its small size and ornamental value, it is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal in miniature gardens.
